greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of aperiodic compositions of n where every pair of adjacent parts (including the last with the first) is relatively prime.
comment: A sequence is aperiodic if all of its cyclic rotations are different.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(6) = 20 compositions (empty column not shown):
program: b(n, q, pred)={my(M=matrix(n, n)); for(k=1, n, M[k, k]=pred(q, k); for(i=1, k-1, M[i, k]=sum(j=1, k-i, if(pred(j, i), M[j, k-i], 0)))); M[q, ]}
seq(n)={my(v=sum(k=1, n, b(n, k, (i, j)->gcd(i, j)==1))); vector(n, n, sumdiv(n, d, moebius(d)*v[n/d]))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Nov 01 2019
xref: The non-aperiodic version is A328609 or A318748 (with singletons).
The non-aperiodic, non-circular version is A167606.
The Lyndon word case is A328669.
Lyndon compositions are A059966, with relatively prime case A318731.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 29 2019
ext: Terms a(21) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Nov 01 2019
